items.title: Update xkos-best-practices.html
items.body: add example concept association with creation or deletion of classification item

items.title: Dimensions with codelists which use concepts from multiple namespaces are difficult to create and manage
items.body:
# Mixing codelists

There are two common scenarios we're facing:

1. A user primarily adopts an external taxonomy, but extends with their own bespoke codes, often _Unknown_ or _Total_.
2. A user mixes concepts from two or more external taxonomies (e.g., ONS statistical geographies and NUTS2, or mixing `reference.data.gov.uk/id/year/xxxx` and `reference.data.gov.uk/id/quarter/xxxx-Qx`).


_Example of 1:_
```
Geography Code
UKA
UKB
UKC
UKD
...
Unknown
Total
```

_Example of 2:_
```
Geography Code
UKA
UKB
UKC
...
E0000001
E0000002
```

In either of these cases, we have a situation where codes are coming from multiple namespaces. The `CSVW` spec doesn't provide a method of applying a URI template over a subset of the `.csv`.

Further, there is a question on how best to represent that a dimension uses concepts from several concept schemes - should a new, "super codelist" be defined locally to the dimension, or are we able to provide multiple codelists?

items.title: REST API: content-type incorrect, results in encoding issues
items.body:
We noticed a small issue with the REST API. It actually returns correctly UTF-8-encoded JSON, but wrongly specifies the content type as `text/plain`.

In our case, this leads to the data being interpreted as ASCII or ISO-8859-1 (e.g. by Python Requests package), and hence the encoding of any non-ASCII content is messed up in the result.

Simple example to illustrate (some output lines skipped):

```json
(env) colin@EQAR-MBA-CT:~/Documents/Temp/deqar/ebsi$ cat req2.json | jq --arg issuer did:ebsi:zk4bhCepWSYp9RhZkRPiwUL '.+{issuer:$issuer} | {issuerDid:$issuer,credentialOffer:tostring}' | http -v POST 10.12.11.190:7000/v1/vc/create
POST /v1/vc/create HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json, */*;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Length: 1170
Content-Type: application/json
Host: 10.12.11.190:7000
User-Agent: HTTPie/2.3.0

{
    "credentialOffer": "{\"@context\":[\"https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials/v1\",\"https://data.deqar.eu/context/v1.jsonld\"],\"id\":\"https://data.deqar.eu/report/9121\",\"type\":[\"VerifiableCredential\",\"VerifiableAttestation\"],\"issuer\":\"did:ebsi:zk4bhCepWSYp9RhZkRPiwUL\",\"credentialSubject\":{\"id\":\"did:ebsi:zZvL2dtbN8NNNt5gWP5HtyF\",\"authorizationClaims\":{\"accreditationType\":\"http://data.europa.eu/snb/accreditation/e57dddfcf3\",\"decision\":\"positive\",\"report\":[\"http://backend.testzone.eqar.eu/reports/fmid/20190218_1308_informe_definitivo_35387.pdf\"],\"limitQualification\":[{\"title\":\"Máster Universitario en Asesoramiento y Consultoría Jurídico-Laboral\",\"alternativeLabel\":[],\"limitEQFLevel\":\"http://data.europa.eu/snb/eqf/7\"}]}},\"issuanceDate\":\"2018-07-23T00:00:00Z\",\"validFrom\":\"2018-07-23T00:00:00Z\",\"expirationDate\":\"2022-07-23T00:00:00Z\",\"credentialStatus\":{\"id\":\"https://essif.europa.eu/status/45\",\"type\":\"CredentialsStatusList2020\"},\"credentialSchema\":{\"id\":\"https://data.deqar.eu/schema/v1.json\",\"type\":\"JsonSchemaValidator2018\"}}",
    "issuerDid": "did:ebsi:zk4bhCepWSYp9RhZkRPiwUL"
}


HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Length: 848
Content-Type: text/plain
Date: Wed, 24 Nov 2021 19:54:28 GMT

{
    [...]
    "credentialSubject": {
        "authorizationClaims": {
            "accreditationType": "http://data.europa.eu/snb/accreditation/e57dddfcf3",
            "decision": "positive",
            "limitQualification": [
                {
                    "alternativeLabel": [],
                    "limitEQFLevel": "http://data.europa.eu/snb/eqf/7",
                    "title": "MÃ¡ster Universitario en Asesoramiento y ConsultorÃa JurÃdico-Laboral"
                }
            ],
    [...]
}
```

items.title: Define a recommended context to import
items.body:
Instead of normatively requiring an initial context, such as RDFa does, instead JSON-LD has the ability to import contexts.  This approach means that the existing context rules are followed, and the best practice context can be updated over time as new norms emerge in the community.  If the best practice context is not useful to a particular community, then they don't need to import it.

To Do:

- [ ] Discuss the set of ontologies to include as prefixes
- [ ] Discuss the set of aliases and term definitions to include (e.g. `id`, `type`, `label`, `comment`)
- [ ] Create and publish context document in /ns/

**Thüringen**

items.title: European Case Law Identifier (ECLI)
items.body:
They have DOI for journals, ISBN for books… in Europe we have ECLI for judicial decisions. How can this be integrated in CSL?

(ECLI is supposed to work in the European Union, including in EU Member states jurisdictions, it is not limited to decisions from EU bodies).

items.title: What are the licenses of data used by OQT?

labels.name: priority:high
labels.description: Should be addressed as soon as possible (next release)

items.body:
For the end user it should be clear what the licenses are. E.g. the swagger documentation could point to them.

## OSM 

through ohsome API: https://ohsome.org/copyrights


## GHS POP

The GHSL has been produced by the EC JRC as open and free data – Reuse is authorised, provided the source is acknowledged. For more information, please read the use conditions: https://ec.europa.eu/info/legal-notice_en

https://ghsl.jrc.ec.europa.eu/documents/GHSL_Data_Package_2019.pdf 

How to cite Dataset: Schiavina, Marcello; Freire, Sergio; MacManus, Kytt (2019):  GHS population grid multitemporal (1975-1990-2000-2015), R2019A. European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC) [Dataset] doi:10.2905/0C6B9751-A71F-4062-830B-43C9F432370F PID: http://data.europa.eu/89h/0c6b9751-a71f-4062-830b-43c9f432370f

Concept & Methodology: Freire, Sergio; MacManus, Kytt; Pesaresi, Martino; Doxsey-Whitfield, Erin; Mills, Jane (2016): Development of new open and free multi-temporal global population grids at 250 m resolution. Geospatial Data in a Changing World; Association of Geographic Information Laboratories in Europe (AGILE). AGILE 2016.


## GADM

The data are freely available for academic use and other non-commercial use. Redistribution, or commercial use, is not allowed without prior permission. Using the data to create maps for academic publishing is allowed. 

https://gadm.org/license.html


## NUTS

https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/gisco/geodata/reference-data/administrative-units-statistical-units

items.title: Attribution does not cover most MARC relators and other roles

labels.name: feedback
labels.description: Issues stemming from external feedback to the WG

milestone.title: Future Work (DCAT 4 ?!)
milestone.description: This milestone collects the issues and requirements to consider in future versions of DCAT.

items.body:
Status:

Identifier:

Creator: janvoskuil

Deliverable(s): DCAT 2, DCAT 3 specification

## Stakeholders
data publisher

## Problem statement
Paragraph 13.1 of DCAT 2 and DCAT 3 states that MARC relators like 'funder', 'custodian' etc can be expressed using prov:Attribution. This is not correct, since prov:Attribution implies by definition that the attributee was directly involved in the activity that generated the entity and bore some responsibility for that activity.

## Existing approaches
In one of my assignments, we used an alternative approach by definining x:Involvement, x:involved and x: qualifiedInvolvement. See the link for detailed discussion

## Links
https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/modelling-marc-relators-using-prov-how-fix-dcat-2-jan-voskuil

## Requirements
Supply vocabulary to enable data publishers to incorporate MARC relators and other roles in metadata structures in a unified and simple way

## Related use cases

## Comments


---

items.title: Availability description error in the https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SEMICeu/DCAT-AP/2.1.0-draft/releases/2.1.0/dcat-ap_2.1.0.rdf file
items.body:
Hi,

Looking at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SEMICeu/DCAT-AP/2.1.0-draft/releases/2.1.0/dcat-ap_2.1.0.rdf we noticed that at the end of the file there is an error in the description of "http://data.europa.eu/r5r/availability/experimental"

I think that the definition of "experimental" should be different from "available".  I think the skos:definition of "experimental" should be something like:
<skos:definition xml:lang="en">Data might be available for a short period, short term planning.</skos:definition>

items.body:
Je souhaite créer un tableau qui utilise des scripted fields pour calculer des valeurs dans certaines conditions

1. Ressource qui a été examinée pour définir si elle est dans INSPIRE ou pas : trois valeurs possibles
- mot-clé "Reporting INSPIRE" --> Oui
- mot-clé "Reporting INSPIRENO" --> Non
- ni mot-clé "Reporting INSPIRE" ni mot-clé "Reporting INSPIRENO" --> indéfini

2. Diviser une chaine de caractères
- custodianOrgForResource doit être séparé en nom du gestionnaire et hiérarchie du gestionnaire : "Direction de la Protection des Sols (SPW - Agriculture, Ressources naturelles et Environnement - Département du Sol et des Déchets - Direction de la Protection des Sols)" devient "Direction de la Protection des Sols" + "SPW - Agriculture, Ressources naturelles et Environnement - Département du Sol et des Déchets - Direction de la Protection des Sols"

items.title: shacl/v.1.2.1 - dct:publisher does not have shape http://data.europa.eu/r5r/mdrcv#CorporateBodyRestriction
items.body:
We tested a few of our datasets with the EDP tool (https://www.europeandataportal.eu/shacl/) and found that some validation errors are falsely:

Example RDF: https://www.govdata.de/ckan/dataset/strassenverkehrsunfalle-in-schleswig-holstein-im-november-2007-vorlaufige-zahlen.rdf

**XML:**
```
    <dct:publisher>
      <foaf:Organization rdf:about="http://opendata.schleswig-holstein.de/organization/statistikamt-nord">
        <foaf:name>Statistisches Amt für Hamburg und Schleswig-Holstein - Anstalt des öffentlichen Rechts - (Statistikamt Nord)</foaf:name>
      </foaf:Organization>
    </dct:publisher>
```

**Error:**
```
    {
      "@id": "_:b11",
      "@type": "sh:ValidationResult",
      "focusNode": "http://opendata.schleswig-holstein.de/dataset/StaNord_CMS:55265",
      "resultMessage": "Value does not have shape http://data.europa.eu/r5r/mdrcv#CorporateBodyRestriction",
      "resultPath": "dct:publisher",
      "resultSeverity": "sh:Violation",
      "sourceConstraintComponent": "sh:NodeConstraintComponent",
      "sourceShape": "_:b7",
      "value": "http://opendata.schleswig-holstein.de/organization/statistikamt-nord"
    }
```

**Possible reason/problem in the SHACL-files:**
A workaround would be to extract the publisher node and add all missing classes (not part of this issue) and to add him to the list, using `skos:inScheme`:
```
  <dcat:Dataset>
    <dct:publisher rdf:resource="..............."/>
  </dcat:Dataset>

<rdf:Description rdf:about="...............">
    <rdf:type rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Concept"/>
    <rdf:type rdf:resource="http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Agent" />
    <rdf:type rdf:resource="http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Organization" />
    <skos:inScheme rdf:resource="http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/corporate-body"/>
    <foaf:name>Statistisches Amt für Hamburg und Schleswig-Holstein - Anstalt des öffentlichen Rechts - (Statistikamt Nord)</foaf:name>
</rdf:Description>
```

But in my opinion (and that's how I'm reading the DCAT-AP specification), the publisher shouldn't be limited to that list:
>  The Corporate bodies NAL must be used for European institutions and a small set of international organisations. In case of other types of organisations, national, regional or local vocabularies should be used.

**Background**
dcat-ap.de is a German variation of dcat-ap. Our goal was, that all valid dcat-ap.de files are also valid dcat-ap files. We only reduced options and added specific fields.

GovData.de is (for example) a data portal where dcat-ap.de is used. GovData.de data is also collected by the EDP. We are now trying to improve the meta data quality, especially the dcat-ap compliance (https://www.europeandataportal.eu/mqa/govdata?locale=en).

Also posted at: https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/mqa/shacl-validation/issues/5

items.title: Cardinality of dct:format/dcat:mediaType in combination with dcat:package/compressFormat
items.body:
Hello,

with the inclusion of `dcat:packageFormat` and `dcat:compressFormat` shouldn't it be possible to have multiple `dct:format` or `dcat:mediaTypes`?

Otherwise we would imply that all files within a zip have the same format.

items.title: Non conformité pour le rapportage

labels.name: INSPIRE
labels.description: Problème lié à la conformité INSPIRE

milestone.title: 4.0.8 - Reporting INSPIRE
milestone.description:
Version de Metawal en ordre pour le monitoring annuel de décembre 2021
- Connexion avec token au validateur officiel
- Contenu : marquage des ressources INSPIRE avec tag approprié
- Contenu : validation des fiches
- Correctif : correction du bug de l'étendue temporelle qui rend les fiches invalides sur le portail INSPIRE européen (bug du portail INSPIRE européen)
- Tableaux de bords Kibana pour aide au monitiring

items.body:
Le reporting INSPIRE indique qu'il y a quelques petits soucis. On y regarde plus en interne, mais il y aura sans doute besoin de se coordonner pour voir ce qui est possible de faire et par qui.
https://inspire-geoportal.ec.europa.eu/mr2020_details.html?country=be L’IDS wallonne étant l’onglet INSPIRE-f5201eb0-2404-11e5-8130-52540004b857
Deux points ressortent: 
1. non conformité de Metawal -> intervenir sur le GetCapabilities? On soupconne que le fait que le GetCapabilities retourne seulement le Fre est une cause possible de non conformité, mais à tester que ce serait bien la cause. 
2. certaines data non conformes" mais déclarées ont des problèmes (ex: un des owners déclarés dans la fiche qui n'a pas d'email hors c'est mandatory). A voir en interne SPW comment on gère ca. En même temps il y avait eu https://github.com/SPW-DIG/metawal-core-geonetwork/issues/522

Je propose qu'on en discute le 4/2 avec Dominique Buffet.

items.title: Adding dcatap:availability to dcat:Resource
items.body:
We had the request to add dcatde:plannedAvailablity also to dcat:Dataset (https://github.com/GovDataOfficial/DCAT-AP.de/issues/16)

With the introduction of dcat:Resource, we are thinking about allowing it there as well. 
Especially for a DataService we see the usecase for stating whethter it is stable, experimental or deprecated.

Is this something you could consider for DCAT-AP as well?

items.title: SHACL-Webinar: Validation of Codelists
items.body:
Thank you again for doing the SHACL-Webinar and releasing the [screencast](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9I8IOhsg2hg). We now had a chance to revisit the discussed problems and solutions. (See: #162)
We want to move forward with the validation of DCAT-AP.de for GovData.de and we would like to do so by re-using the shapes from DCAT-AP.

Around the 90-minute mark, we discussed, how codelists should be used within the SHACL-rules.

It was our understanding, that the use of `skos:inScheme` is an acceptable way, as long as the used codelist is of reasonable size. Since even http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/corporate-body with over 1000 entries can be handled by the tools, we think we can use this way for all code lists.
But as with the integrated background knowledge (#163), we have to decide how we announce/show, which lists are checked. We would, again, prefer a way which is visible within the SHACL-shapes, not only in the tool configuration.

(There is one coldelist where this approach doesn’t work: http://data.europa.eu/r5r/availability/  <-- DCAT-AP’s own codelist.)

items.title: Split biomass types into country specific cost supply categories
Add numac number as eli:id_local
items.body:
In order to easily be able to query legal resources based on their Numac-number, we added those as an extra property to parse. The RDF-DocWriter serializes this property under the `http://data.europa.eu/eli/ontology#id_local`-predicate, which is meant for country-local identifiers such as the Belgian "Numac".

cc @barthanssens
